description:
Part of MAGES' multimedia "Idol Jihen" project.

The anime takes place in a parallel-world Japan, where idols stand up against a corrupt government as "idol Diet members," and then work to bring back the smiles of the Japanese people through song and dance. The idol Diet members belong to seven different political parties, including the Heroine Party, the SOS Party, the Subculture New Party, the Bishōjo Party, the Wakaba Party, the Starlight Party, and the Sanrai Party.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
[Website](https://highkick.jp/tateyama)

He is a drummer for the Japanese rock band THE LINDA!, which was formed in 2002 when its members were enrolled at Rikkyo University.

[Official Website](http://coconutbless.com/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/nachucoco) | [Pixiv](http://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=288052)

[On April 20, 2022, it was reported that Natsuki had died on April 18th due to stomach cancer.](https://twitter.com/nachucoco/status/1516753794356301836)

__Current Residence:__ Saitama, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ Atelier Tiv Artworks (アトリエティブアートワークス)

[Website](http://planova.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tiv_) | [Tumblr](http://tivatelier.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tiv_0225/)

__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Higashiosaka City, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kinki University (Faculty of Commerce)

__Introduction:__
Mitsuo Terada, alternatively known by stage name Tsunku, is a prolific Japanese record producer, songwriter, and vocalist.

__Biography:__
He is best known for having two major roles in the Japanese music landscape: first as the lead singer of the popular rock group Sharam Q, and now as the producer, primary composer, lyricist, and (until 2014) primary studio backing vocalist for highly popular idol group [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/), in addition to Aya Matsuura and other associated idols under the Hello! Project banner, for whom he has written and produced the vast majority of their chart-topping hits. 

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsunku))

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3298914906)

Originating from [Imagin](https://anilist.co/studio/75/). Started off as a production manager.
**Shimizu Tomoyuki (清水友幸)** is a Japanese art director and background artist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [illustrator](https://anilist.co/staff/122887/)._

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.
